result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery T. Johnston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:30 p.m. Defendant Zachery T. Johnston in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm313, 15cm144, 15tr1724, 15fo923, 15cm376, 15cm266, 15tr1725. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read in Case nos. 15cm376 and 15cm266 - Granted.  In 15fo923 and 151725 - State moves to dismiss - Granted. In 15CM313 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 -7 - Granted. In 15cm144, State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence:
In 15tr1724
Fine - $762.00 -probation to collect as courtesy
Driver's License revoked - 6 months
AODA Assessment
Driver's safety plan

In 15cm313 and 15cm144
WHS/POP 2 years CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Attend school on all school days and attend all classes on time. If misses class must be pre-arranged with prior approval from school or based on medical excuse with written note from doctor that states sufficient ill to not go to school
Must comply with all school rules while at school
Work to best of ability in school
Continue school until obtain high school diploma
Community Service - 50 hrs
Apology letter to Jeremiah Snyder - victim in 15CM313
Jail credit - 5 days
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes all probation and pays all fines/costs
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 2:57 p.m.
Must attend school every day, every registered class on -time unless medical excuse is accompanied by letter from doctor indicating too ill to attend school

1:32 p.m. Defendant Zachery T. Johnston in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig/Hogan statement to bail. Court sets $500 sig bond. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 1:34 p.m.
